sanctificata ad priuatos vsus transferre peccatum est periculum sicut docet no balthasar qui bibens calicibus sacratis de regno depositus est de vita si ergo haec vas sanctificata ad priuatos vsus transferre sic periculosum est quibus non est verum corpus christi sed mysterium corporis christi continetur quanto magi vas corporis nostri quae sibi deus ad habitaculum preparauit non debemus locum dare diabolo agendi eis quod vult offence translate sanctified vessel priuate v daunger balthasar doth teach v drinking hallowed cup put kingdome life therfore daungerous transferre vnto priuate v sanctified vessel body christ mysterie body christ conteyned howe much vessel body god hath prepared dwelling place selfe ought yeld diuil hee third shall bee pope owne cannon lawe heskins may refuse vntruly rehearsed thus hee maketh augustine speake treatise de consensu euangelistarum naming booke chapter whereas writeth matter lib cap non enim incongruenter accipimus hoc impedimentum oculis eorum satana fuisse ne agnosceretur iesus sed tantum christo propter eorum fidem ambiguam facta est permissio v que ad sacramentum panis vt vnitate corporis eius participata remoueri intelligatur whome christe abydeth doubt doth neither spiritually eat flesh drinke bloud although carnally visibly presse teeth sacrament bodie bloud christ rather eateth drinketh sacrament great thing owne condemnation thus augustine teacheth flesh christe eaten whome difference betweene flesh bloud christ sacrament thereof point directly contrarie papistes affirme flesh christ eaten mouth eaten wicked last sacrament flesh christ flesh one tenth chapter prouing aduersaries bodie christ may moe place one hesk heskins taketh occasion doubtful ye iewes answer ye proclaimers fulke christ body may thousand place moe first trifleth ye number place though hee required lesse thousand bableth natural philosophie though faith buylded therevpon whereas papistes especially schoolman euen lothsomnesse reason natural philosophie greatest mystery faith put doubt buyld vpon scripture faith trueth christes bodie cannot bee place one apostle sayth respect humaine nature made like brother thing sinne ab eo dictum est ecce ego vobiscum sum omnibus diebus vsque ad consumationem saeculi secundum carnem vero quam verbum sumpsit secundum id quod de virgine natus est secundum id quod iudae prehensus est praedestinated called glorified euen sayntes faithfull one afterwarde sayeth huius rei sacramentum id est vnitatis corporis sanguinis christi alicubi quotidie alicubi certis interuallis dieru dominica mensa preparatur de mensa dominica sumitur quibusdam ad vitam quibusdam ad exitium re vero ipsa cuius sacramentum est omni homini ad vitam nulli ad exitium quicunque eius particeps fuerit sacrament beneficentiam vetare figura est nisi manducaueritis inquit carn filij hominis sanguinem biberitis non habebitis vitam vobis facinur vel flagitium videtur iubere figura est ergo praecipiens passioni endeth exposition text theophylact beda two lower house testimonie theophylactus maketh nothing fulke saying beda maketh much concerning theophylact let list read sentence compt superfluous rehearse drinketh bloud hath life eternall might shewe howe great difference betweene corporall meate spirituall mysterie bodie bloud added fleshe meate deede bloud drink deede beda calleth sacrament spiritual formes breade wine determine forsooth well christ would shewe difference spirituall foode flesh bloud thing conteined accident bread wine corporall foode foolishe conclusion beda rather false sacrament vnder mysterie termes restreint hath shewe manner eating sacramentall mysticall heskins would carnall naturall christ truely one god vnitie vnitie godhead substance diuinitie essence liue father mee c vnitie v naturall hath witnessed saying eateth flesh drinketh bloud abideth mee shall man whome shalbe hauing onely assumpted flesh hath taken place would buyld destinction naturall spirituall abyding manifestly ouerthrowne drift distinction confesseth shewe christe may abyde naturally doth abyde spiritually wicked place hillarie plain naturall vnitie christe abydeth eternally therefore naturall vnitie wicked thus maister heskins harpeth greedily vppon terme naturally naturall presence christes bodie looseth distinction naturall presence also bodie naturally receiued wicked naturally present sacrament papistes confesse natural vnitie spirituall manner appeareth last wordes sentence whome christ dwelleth hath onely assumpted flesh christ must needes spirituall manner holie innocent fleshe christe made oures therefore naturall vnitie speaketh sense naturall maister heskins immagineth diuine vnspeakable manner otherwise godly men haue fleshe owne yea sinfull fleshe v therefore whosoeuer shall denye father naturally christ let first denye either naturally christe christ father christ christ v make v one therefore christ verily take vppon fleshe bodie man borne vnder sacrament wee eate fleshe bodie vnder mysterie naturall propertie sacrament sacrament perfecte vnitie besides marke naturall vnitie thereby vnited father vnited father christ must needes followe made partaker eternitie wicked men therefore wicked men receiue christ naturally spiritually distinction remaineth without difference nowe come augustine whome borroweth parte distinction tract ioan condemnation vncleane presumed come sacrament christe man receiueth worthily hee cleane whome sayed blessed cleane hart shall see god augustine word maketh distinctio eating sacrament bodie bloud containeth effect christ concerning humanitie would ascend thither concerning diuinitie reason vnion two nature one person christe often spoken whole person proper either diuine nature onely humane ascend heauen whole shall see sonne man ascending certainly euen least shall see giueth foorth body manner thinke certainly euen least shall vnderstand grace consumed bytinges although place directly nothing bee plaine yet hee ashamed cyte purpose affirming augustine wordes denyeth giuing christes bodye manner giuing bodye wee confesse manner giuing doth hee denye maister heskins saith onely either peeces much lesse whole ye giuing thereof whole much monstruous giuing therof peeces remained corporall receipt whole bodie notwithstanding absenting thereof earth doubt ascention nothing cut waste tunc autem c lorde setting foorth spoken flesh saide except man eate flesh shall haue life euerlasting seuentie offended saide harde saying vnderstand departed walked seemed harde thing sought sermon ad norphil might haue spared great deale labour haue lost searching yet cannot finde many homily sermon augustine ad neophyl yet none reade whiche aduouched seemeth therefore place taken later writer yt without iudgement ascribeth augustine found workes yet saying yt may haue reasonable interpretatio ye bread certein maner augustine speaketh yt hang crosse wine yt shed side yt sacrametally naturally bodily maner cyril followeth ca sup ioan ex imperitia multi c many folowed christ lack knowledge vnderstanding wordes troubled hearde verily verily say vnto except shall eate dispensation mysterie also moreouer thinke howe shall flesh man giue v eternall life bring v immortalitie thing vnderstod whose eye thing bare open driueth faith maruelous thing without cause saith syre ye troubled word beleeue life giuen bodie vnto see flie vp heauen doe onely say ascend least aske againe shall see eye done therfore say see shall great argument madnesse thinke fleshe bring life vnto shall ascend heauen like birde shall flye ayre like impossible mankinde fleshe beside nature shall ascende heauen letteth may likewise beside nature giue life cyrill noteth heskins saith two vaine thoughtes capernaites one eating raw flesh christ yt flesh shuld giue life latter answereth large breefely vnderstoode fourme dispensation mysterie meaneth spirituall mysticall maner receiuing capernaites imagination teacheth diuided without paine parted without diminution eaten without consumption spirite quickeneth fleshe beeing receiued vnderstoode giueth eternall life vnderstand spirituall receiuing sixe thirtieth chapter createth next text augustine chrysostome hesk fulke text spirite quickeneth fleshe profiteth nothing text made familiar saith boyes girles blatter christes presence sacrament though denied vertue fleshe denie carnal presence sacrament must heare saint augustine tract ioan quid est quod adi ngit c ioyneth spirite quickeneth flesh profiteth nothing let v say vnto suffreth v gainsaying desirous know lord good maister doeth flesh profite thing hast said except man eate flesh drink bloud shal haue life doth life profite thing wherfore may haue eternal life thou doest promise thy flesh profiteth thing flesh profiteth nothing vnderstoode vnderstoode fleshe rent peeces dead bodie solde shamble quickened spirit therfore saide flesh profiteth nothing saide knowledge puffeth vp man shall nowe hate knowledge god forbid knowledge p ffeth vp beeing alone without charitie therefore added charitie doth edifie therefore adde charitie knowledge knowledge shalbe profitable selfe charitie likewise fleshe profiteth nothing fleshe alone let spirite come flesh charitie commeth knowledge profiteth verie much flesh profi ed nothing worde haue beene made flesh might dwell v christ haue profited v much flesh doeth flesh profite nothing spirite flesh hath done thing health fleshe vessel marke apostle sent flesh profite nothing flesh apostle profited v could lordes flesh profite v came sound word vnto v voyce flesh whence stile whence writing workes flesh spirite mouing instrument therefore spirite quickeneth flesh profiteth nothing vnderstoode flesh giue flesh eaten maister heskins doth glorie bringeth sentence truncately heretiques wholy reader defrauded augustine right meaning vpo scripture repeateth rotten distinction christ giueth flesh lumpes peeces yet giueth corporally augustine meaneth none otherwise long sentence rehearsed hath omitted interpretation text hand augustine maketh wordes quid est spiritus vita spiritualiter intelligenda sunt spirite life spiritually vnderstanded neither one worde treatise corporall presence receiuing yet cofesse christ truly giueth v fleshe truely fed therewith corporall maner spiritual vnspeakable maner chrysostome cited hom ioan quid igitur caro c doth fleshe profite nothing speaketh flesh god forbid carnally take thing spoken vnderstand carnally simply thinges spoken thinke thing th se thinges seene iudged mystery considered inwarde eye spiritually eateth flesh drinketh bloud hath life selfe doeth fleshe profite nothing without man liue see particle flesh profiteth thing spoken fleshe selfe carnall hearing hesk saith chrysostome needeth expositor open exposition yt iudgment plaine al grosse carnal imagination mystery nothing plainer saith vnderstand thinges ye sixt iohn simply spoken vnderstad carnally ought mystery must vnderstood spiritually receiuing christ sacrament mysterie therfore must vnderstaded spiritually seuen thirtieth chapter proceedeth vpon text theophylact bernarde hesk theophylacte following chrysostome fulke doth much whe carried corruption time saith wordes christ must vnderstood spiritually whervpon hesk maketh obiection word may vnderstood spiritually yet ye carnal presence receiuing retained answereth yt papist also confesse word christ must vnderstode spiritually first alledgeth theophylacte proue allowed carnal presence though vndoutedly proue yet considering ye time liued may granted allow marie spiritual vnderstading letteth ye carnal presence haue shewed yt theophylact wold followe chrysost yet mainteine errour time maruel though contrarie spiritual vnderstanding hesk definition vnderstand yt thinges done naturall meane spirit god namely transubstantiation like chrysostom sawe chapter determined otherwise christ could nothing make change thinges lesse thing giue newe nature thinges chaunge nature hitherto haue heard ambrose speaking earnestly change nature sacrament heare expound place spirituall change vera vtique caro christi quae crucifixa est quae sepulta est vere ergo carnis illius sacramentum est ipse clamat dominus iesus hoc est corpus mo ante benedictionem verborum coelestium ali specie nominatur post consecrationem corpus christi significatur ipse dicit sanguinem suum ante consecrationem ud dicitur post consecrationem sanguis nuncupatur verie fleshe christ crucified buried therefore truely sacrament flesh lord iesus crieth saying bodie benediction heauenly wordes called another kinde consecration bodie christ signified himselfe saith bloud consecration called another thing consecration called bloud place againe illo sacramento christus est quia corpus est christi non ergo corporalis esca sed spirituali est sacrament christ bodie christe therefore corporall meate deum coepi vt subueniret ne cuius sanguis causa ecclesiae fieret certe vt meus sanguis pro salute non solum populi sed etiam pro ipsis impijs effunderetur quid multa missis presbyteris diaconis eripui falsifier canon decree thus citeth sacerdotes quando c priestes offer sacrifice vnto lorde ought alone let take witness may proued sacrifice perfectly vnto lord place dedicated god according deutron wordes decree priestes commaunded get witness tolde ought alone hesk iustifie falsification spanish garanza saith omnes ministri communicent let minister communicate though commaundement people bringeth forth patch two epistle anacletus trueth proclaimer falshood exclaimer may manifest set downe discourse matter epistle set forth vnder ye name anacletus peter crabbe errant papist bartholomew garanza heart nothing therein diuersitie letter yt hesk hath rent rest ipsi autem quando domino sacrificant non solo hoc agere debent sed testis secum adhibeat vt domino perfecte sacratis deo sacrificare locis probentur ait nam que authoritas legis diuine vide ne offeras holocausta tua omni loco quem videris sed loco quem elegeris dominus deus tuus episcopus deo sacrificans testis vt praefixum est secum habeat plures quam alius sacerdos sicut enim maioris honoris gradu fruitur sic maioris testimonij incrementatione indiget solennioribus quippe diebus aut septem aut quin que aut tres diaconos qui eius oculus dicuntur subdiaconos que reliquos ministros secum habeat qui sacris induti vestimentis fronte tergo presbyteri e regione dextra laeua que contrito corde humiliato spiritu ac prono stent vultu custodientes eum maleuolis hominibus consension eius praebeant sacrificio peracta aue consecratione omnes comunicent qui noluerint ecclesiasticis carere liminibus sic enim apostoli statueruns sanctum romana tenes ecclesia priestes sacrifice ought alone let take witness yt may proued sacrifice lord perfectly place dedicated god authoritie god law sayeth take heede thou offer thy burnt offering euerie place thou shalt see ye place lord thy god shall choose let bishop sacrificing god haue witness sayed another priest enioyeth degree greater honor hath need increase greater testimonie solemne dayes let haue either seuen fiue three deacon called eye subdeacon rest minister cloathed holie vestimentes let stand behind priest ouer right hand left hande contrite heart humbled spirite sober countenaunce preseruing malicious men let giue consent sacrifice consecration ended let al communicate depriued entrie church wordes epistle hesk mangleth falsifieth thus episcopus c bishop sacrifice vnto god let solemne dayes haue either seuen fiue three deacon called eye subdeacon minister first leaueth priest ought sacrifice alone must take witness wt secondly bishop ought haue another priest time thirdly hee citeth word though bishop haue neede witness solemne dayes fourthly leaueth deacon minister stand behind bishop agree popish altar stande popish priest except stand windowe vppon altar finally wheras omnes may reasonably vnderstood al present restraineth onely ye minister yet ouerthroweth popish priuat masse twentie fortie priest clarkes often many masse sometimes hundreth synode yet one wil receiue ye priest neither banished yt refuse comunicate proue yt word referred clergie citeth apost si quis episcopus c bishop c oblation made communicate either let shew cause reasonable may obteine pardon shew none let excommunicated one cause offence people giuing suspition sacrifice hath wel offered cano must interpretatio ye epistle though yet priuate masse neuer better case still number necessarily bounde communicate priest vnder paine excommunication hesk sayeth possible might bishop bene three attendant vpon small number might haue cause absteine possibilitie like come esse yeares findeth yt bishop might haue three decree cited requireth three deacon least beside subdeacon minister auncient church great store diuerse function acolyte exercistes reader dorekeepers c admitt possible absteine yet saith prohibition ye priest receiue alone decree sayeth ought sacrifice alone canon commaund christian especially clergie present comunicate yet hesk sayeth prohibited saye masse alone yt sayd yt priuate masse naught reason aunswers let reader iudge cleare proofe ouerthrow ye proclaimers challege hesk sayth masse chrysost plain rule giuen done priest receiued alone proclaimer learned farre know indeed high point learning hesk ye proclaimer could neuer attain vnto play reader nose impudently cannot smell falshod beare hande yt chrysostomes masse written seuen hundreth yeres chrysostome dead appeareth plainly prayer pope nicolas emperour alexius proclaimer vnlearned make yet wit finde laye abrode open shame shame vse liturgie authenticall rightly ascribed chrysostome issue ioyne priuate masse naught prohibited scripture councel catholike writer tryed alreadie sufficient euidence giuen b sarum harding answere counterfet false euidence vttered chapter next receiuing sicke man alone hath nothing priuate masse sole receiuing admitted yet case extreme necessitie approoueth vsuall dayly contempt christes holy institution one fortieth chapter prooueth masse may bee said sacrament receiued without number communicantes one time one place hesk saide done saith hesk masse shalbe holy good shalbe trueth fulke yt priest saying masse man godly disposed sicke whole may receiue holy sacrament alone profe vseth reason thing forbidden v aduersarie sayth conteyned scripture priuate masse sole caecilium thus writeth sic vero calix domini non est aqua sola aut vinum solum nisi vtrumque sibi misceatur quomodo nec corpus domini potest esse farina sola aut aqua sola nisi vtrumque adunatum sacrament therof whiche manner speache called body christ word find augustine sounding thing like et sanctum possunt obesse bonis enim sanctum ad salutem insunt mali ad iudicium certe enim fratres nouimus quid accipiamus vtique sanctum est quod accipimus nemo dicit non esse sanctum et quid ait apostolus qui autem manducat bibit indigne iudicium sibi manducat bibit non ait quia illa re mala est sed quod ille malus male accipiendo ad iudicium accipit bonum quod accipit non enim mala buccella erat quae tradita est iudae domino absit medicus non daret venenum salutem medicus dedit sed indigne accipiendo ad perniciem accepit euen holy thing may hurte good men holy thing vnto saluation euill men vnto condemnation surely brother know receiue man sayeth holy sayeth apostle eateth drinketh vnworthily eateth drinketh owne condemnation sayeth thing euill euill man euill receiuing receiueth vnto condemnation good thing receiueth morsell euill deliuered lorde iudas god forbidde phisition woulde giue poyson phisition gaue health hee receiuing vnwoorthily receiued destruction iudgement augustine wee doe subscribe wicked men receiue holye thing namely sacrament prophaning whereof heape vp damnation selues besides sinnes naturall bodie christe voyde quickening spirite entreth mouth man wee doe vtterly denye iudgement augustine haue shewed chapter many place nine fourtieth chapter continueth exposition isychius sedulius hesk beginning chapter saying augustine hee exhorteth v heare doctoures fulke catholike church affirming yt hath alreadie brought sixe plainely expounding texte bodie christ bring hereafter whereas proclaimer required onely one trueth affirmation reader doubt able discerne blinded affection isichyus cited leuit cap propter quod c wherefore let v feare holie place neither defile bodie rashly come bodie christe sanctification abydeth fullnesse godhead without diligent examination selues rather let v examine selues remembring sayde whosoeuer shall eate shewe theophylact fullnesse godhead doth dwell christe length commeth ridiculous question dehort wicked men eating bodie christ cannot eat though presumption may bee condemned cannot attaine purpose shoulde wicked men bee dehorted seeking ouerthrowe christe church seeing impossible preuayle either one yet maister heskins thinketh selfe wittie sayeth strange persuade man pull downe heauen eat no intelligeremus illud ab eo mysterium dici quod simul panis est caro therefore commaunding flesh bee eaten breade wee might vnderstande spake mysterie bread fleshe together see hesychius acknowledged breade bee mysterie naturallye fleshe christe spiritually nowe let v heare sedulius accipite c take ye body though paule sayed take heede ye eate bodie vnworthily seeing bodie christe shall eate vnworthily shame poore eate meate spirituall meate supper lorde againe noteth bodie christ may receiued vnworthie person hee meaneth wicked person otherwise men vnworthie thing followe wordes sedulius hee speaketh receiuing sacrament certeine manner bodie christe also speaketh wicked person reprobate faithfull persones offender greate matter namely shaming poore plentifull feastes eating bodily meate receiue lordes supper place cited lib cap argument wee bring inseparable coniunction christe spirite sayeth vaine though christe bee neuer disioyned spirite yet spirite alwayes effectuall absurde saye quickening spirite christe together bodye wicked worketh life hee weeneth cyprian shall stande whose wordes citeth sermone de coena sacramenta quidem quantum se est c sacrament truely concerning selues cannot without proper vertue neither doeth diuine maiestie meanes absent selfe mystery although sacrament doe suffer selues bee taken touched vnworthie person yet cannot partaker spirite whose infidelitie vnworthinesse gaynsayeth great holinesse therefore giftes sauour life vnto life vnto sauour death vnto death altogether meete contemners grace depriued great benefite puritie greate grace shoulde make dwelling selfe vnworthie person verie wel content yt place shal determine controuersie betweene v cyprian sayeth maiestie god doth neuer absent selfe sacramentes either hee worketh saluation damnation well baptisme lord supper hee speaketh plurall number seeing infidel wicked person cannot bee partaker spirite christe followeth cannot bee partaker bodie christe christ bodie neuer separate spirite augustine contra crescen alledged place quoted lib cap quid de ipso corpore c shall wee saye euen bodie bloude lorde onely sacrifice health although lorde selfe doeth saye except man doe eate fleshe drinke bloud shall haue life doeth apostle teache made hurtfull vse amisse sayeth whosoeuer shall eate breade drinke cuppe lorde vnworthily shalbee appeareth augustine speaketh sacrament thing signifyed sacrament compareth baptisme ministred heretikes lordes supper vnworthily receiued comparison cannot stande except vnderstande outwarde parte thing selfe sacrament receiued euery man life man destruction whosoeuer doth receiue fiftieth chapter sheweth vnderstanding ext effrem primasius hesk effrem cited tract de die iudicij si procul nobis est siloe c siloe whither blinde man sent fulk farre v yet precious cuppe thy bloude full light life neere v beeing much neerer hee purer commeth vnto remayneth vnto v mercifull christ full grace illumination thy knowledge faith holinesse wee come thy cuppe may profite v vnto forgiuenesse sinnes confusion day iudgement whosoeuer vnworthie shall come thy mystery hee condemneth owne soule cleansing himselfe hee might receiue heauenly king immortall brydegrome moste pure chamber brest soule spouse immortall bridegrome heauenly sacramentes couple marriage wee eate bodie drinke bloude hee v wee therefore take heede thy selfe brother make speede garnish continually chamber thine heart vertues hee may make dwelling thee blessed father thou shalt haue praise glorie boasting angel archangel great ioy gladnesse thou shalt enter paradise saying directly contrarie corporall manner eating drinking body bloud christe also absurde opinion wicked receiue body christe maister heskins ashamed onely alledge making also tryfleth nearnesse bloud christe hee sayeth wee denye wee affirme christe bee alwayes heauen though bloude christe cannot purge clense v except come downe heauen bee powred mouthes though faith cannot make christ selfe dwell v effrem sayeth bloud much neerer hee purer commeth vnto cannot hesk vnderstand vnpurer receiuer cup bloud christ farthest vnpure wicked reprobate hee woulde haue bloud christ neere wicked godly againe ephrem saith wee eate drinke body bloude hee v wee face maister heskins papist worlde saye wicked receiue bodye bloud christe christe like syncerity hee vseth racking wordes primasius hee eateth fleshe drinketh bloud abideth mee though saye ea bee eaten drinke bloud dronken many seeme receiue thing abide god god thei affirmed eate damnation hesk hath corrupted place translation may see hee ment nothing falshood trechery latine text citeth thus qui edit meane carneus bibit meum sanguinem manet ego eo pro eo ac si diceret qui sic edent v edenda est sic bibent v bibendus est sanguis meus multi enim cum hoc videantur acciper deo non manent nec deus ipsis quia sibi iudicium manducare perhibentur translateth english thus eateth fleshe drinketh bloud dwelleth mee say shal eate flesh eaten shall drinke bloud dronken many seene receiue sacrament neither dwell god god witnessed eate drinke owne damnation let reader though hee bee meane latinist iudge whether haue corrupted primasius translation especially hee sayeth multi cum hoc videantur accipere whiche manye seeme receiue thing namely body bloud christe whiche hee spake maister heskins turneth manye seene receiue sacrament many seeme bee christian many seeme bee baptized holy ghoste many seeme eate drinke bodie bloud christe doe god dwelleth god therefore take awaye bodie bloude christe eating drinking worthily one fiftieth chapter abydeth exposition texte cassiodorus damascene hesk cassiodorus cited psalm vppon verse fulke tu e sacerdos c thou arte priest order melchizedeche wordes cui enim putest veracitet euidenter aptari nisi domino saluatori qui corpus sanguinem um pani vini erogatione salutariter consecrauis sicut ipse euangelio dicit nisi manducaueritis carnem filij hominis hiberitis eius sanguinem non habebitis vitam vobis sed ista carne sanguine nil cruentum nihil corruptibile men humana concipiat ne sicut dicit apostolus qui enim corpus domini indigne manducat iudicium sibi mandueas sed viuifica ricem substantiam atque salutarem ipsius verbi propriam factam per quam peccatorum remissio aeterno vitae donapraestuntur vnto whome remission sinnes giftes eternall life perfourmed saying directly contrarie maister heskins three assertion namely transsubstantiation carnall maner eating wicked receiuing christes bodye hee hath construing declare signification therefore meaning must need haue translated helthsomly profitably consecrate bodie bloud giuing forth breade wine therfore gaue forth breade wine touching seconde carnall manner presence whereas cassiodorus sayeth ista carne sanguine nil cruentum nihil corruptibile men humana contipia fleshe bloude let minde man conceiue nothing bloudie nothing corruptible maister heskins translateth let minde man conceiue thing grosse thing corruptible whereas mynde author seeing must fleshe bloud conceiue nothing bloudie must conceiue flesh christ present carnally bloud christ present bloudily spiritually addeth quickening healthfull substance giuing forgiuenesse sinnes eternall life receiue therefore impertinent al discourse maister heskins maketh afterwarde ye olde heretikes denyed humanitie diuinitie christe ridiculous rayling hee woulde charge v heresy mainteining trueth carnall manner presence deede sauoureth heresie marcionistes mannyches eutychians bodie bloude christe hee meant ye bread wine sacrament turned bodie bloude christe giuen good badd signes beare name thinges signifyed shall moste plainly appeare woordes theodoret selfe firste dialogue called incommutabilis orthodoxus scis quod deus suum corpus appellauit panem eranistes scio orthodoxus porro etiam alibi carnem tritieum nominauit eran hoc etiam scio audiui enim eum dicentem venit hora vt glorificetur filiut hominis et nisi granum tritici quod cecidit terram mortuum fuerit solum manet sin autem mortuums fuerit fert multum fructum orth mysteriorum autem traditione corpus panem appellauit id quod calito infusum commixtum est sanguinem eran itae nominauit orth atqui quod est secundum naturam corpus corpus iure vocabitur itidem sanguis eran confesio est orth seruator cerie noster nomina commutauit corpori quidem id quod erat symboli signi nomen imposuit symbolo autem quod erat corpuris ita cum se vitem nominasset sanguinem id quod erat symbolum appellauit eran hoc quidem vere dixist vellem autem scire causam mutationisnominum orth manifestum est institutum ijs qui sunt diuinis mysterijs initiati volebat enim eot qui sunt diuinorum mysteriorum participes non attendere naturam eorum quae videntur sed propter nominum permutationem mutationi que fit ex gratia credere qui enim quod natura est corpus triticum panem appellauit vitem se rursus nominauit symbola quae videntur appellatione corporis sanguinis honorauit non naturam quidem mutans sed naturae gratiam adijciens eran et mystice mystica dictum sunt aperte declarata quae non sunt nota omnibus orth quoniam ergo confesso est patriarcham corpus domini vestem indumentum nominasse ad dicendum autem de diuinis mysterijs ingressi sumus dic per veritatem cuius symbolum figuram esse existimas alimentum sanstissimum diuinitatis ne domini christi corporis sanguinis eran clarum quod illorum quorum appellationem susceperunt orth corporis sanguinis dicis eran ita dico orth vi decet amicum veritatis dixisti etenim dominus cum accepisset symbolum aut signum non dixit hoc est deitas mea sed hoc est corpus meum et rursus hic est sanguis meus et alibi panis autem quem ego dabo caro mea est quam ego dabo pro mundi vita eran vera sunt haec sunt enim diuina eloquia orth si ergo vera corpus vtique habuit dominus english thus orthodoxus knowest thou god called body breade eranistes knowe orth moreouer one place called flesh wheate eran also knowe haue heard saying houre come sonne man shall glorified except graine wheate fallen earth dye remaineth alone dye bringeth forth much fruit ortho deliuerie mystery called breade body powred cup mingled bloud eranistes called deede orthodoxus naturall body shall right called body likewise bloud eranistes confessed orthodoxus certainely sauiour chaunged name gaue name body name token signe token name body called selfe vine hee called body token thereof eranistes thou hast saide truely would knowe cause chaunge name orthodoxus purpose manifest made partaker diuine mystery hee would haue partaker diuine mystery regard nature thing seene respect chaunging name giue credite chaunge grace hee called naturall body wheate breade named selfe againe vine euen hee hath honoured token seene name body bloud chaunging nature adding grace vnto nature eranistes mysticall thing vttered mystically thing openly declared knowen men orthodoxus therefore seeing confessed patriarch called lordes body vesture garment entred speake diuine mystery tell truely whereof doest thou thanke holy foode token figure godhead lorde christe body bloud eranistes cleare whose name haue receiued orthodoxus thou saiest body bloud eranistes say orthodoxus thou hast saide becommeth louer trueth lord taken token signe saide godhead body againe bloud place vt enim alia taceam non possunt simul esse membra christi membra meretricis deni que ipse dicent qui manducat carnem meam bibit sanguinem meum manet ego eo ostendit quid sit non sacramento tenus sed reuera corpus christi manducare eius sanguinem bibere hoc est enim christo manere vt illo maneat christus sic enim hoc dixit tanquam diceret qui non manet quo ego non maneo non se dicat aut existimet appellas donum quod offertur post sanctificationem orthodoxus corpus christi sanguinem christ eranistes et credis te participem fieri christi corporis sanguinis orthodoxus ita credo doest thou call gift offered sanctification orthodoxus bodie christe bloud christ eranistes doest thou beleeue thou art made partaker bodie bloud christe orthodoxus doe beleeue thus much maister heskins vouchsafeth rehearse theodoret saith plain place proclaymer reall presence sacrifice howe plaine howe honestly maister heskins rendeth peece rest abuse theodorets name shall perceiue whole discourse set downe orthodoxus dic ergo mystica symbola quae deo dei sacerdotibus offeruntur quorumnam symbola esse dicis eranistes corporis sanguinis domini orthodoxus corporis eius quod vere est eius quod vere non est eranistes quod vere est orthodoxus optime oportet enim imaginis esse exemplar archerypum etenim pictoret imitantur naturam eorum quae videntur pingunt imago eranistes verum orthodoxus si ergo diuina mysteria corpus quod vere est repraesentant ergo corpus etiam nunc domini quoque corpus est non diuinam naturam mutatum sed impletum diuina gloria eranistes opportune accidit vt verba faceres de uinis mysterijs nam ex eo ipso tibi ostendam corpus domini mutari aliam naturam responde ergo ad mea interrogata orthodoxus respondebo eranistes quid appellas donum quod offertur ante inuocationem sacerdotis orthodoxus non oportet ap rte dicere est enim verisimile adesse aliquos mysterijs non initiatos eranister respondeatur aenigmatice orthodoxus id quod fit ex huiusmodi seminibus nutrimentum eranistes aliud etiam signum quomodo nominamus orthodoxus commune etiam hoc nomen quod potus speciem significat eranistes post sanctificationem autem quomodo ea appellas orthodoxus corpus sanguinem christi eranistes et credis te fieri participeni christi corporis sanguinis orthodoxus ita credo eranistes sicut ergo symbola corporis sanguinis domini alia quidem sunt ante inuocationem sacerdotis post inuocationem mutantur alia siunt ita etiam corpus domini post assumptionem mutatur diuinam substantiam orthodoxus quae ipse texuisti retibus captus e neque enim signa mystica post sanctificationem recedunt natura sut manent enim priori substantia figura forma videri tangi possunt sicut prius intelliguntur autem ea esse quae facta sunt creduntur adorantur vt quae illa sint quae creduntur confer ergo imaginem cum exemplari videbis similitudinem oportet enim figuram esse veritati similem illud enim corpus priorem habet formam figuram circumscriptionem vt semel dicam corporis substantiam immortale autem post resurrectionem factum est potentius quam vt vlla illud cadat corruptio interitus sessione que ad dextram dei dignatum est ab omni creatura adoratur vt quod appelletur corpu naturae domini eran atqui symbolum mysticum priorem muta appellationem neque enim amplius nominatur quod vocabatur prius sed corpus appellatur oportet ergo etiam veritatem deum non corpus vocari ortho ignarus mihi videris esse non enim corpus solum sed etiam panis vitae nominatur ita enim dominus ipse appellanit porro autem ipsum corpus diuinum corpus appellanus viuificum dominicum docentes non esse commune alicuius hominis sed domini nostri iesu christi qui est deus homo orthodoxus say mysticall token offered god priestes god thinges sayest thou token eran body bloud lorde orth bodie truely bodie truely eran truly ortho well behoueth patterne example image painter doe followe nature paint image thinges seene eran true orth diuine mystery doe represent bodie bodie deede therefore although like armie men well sett arraye yet haue one chiefe capteine earth direct hee omnipotent fitteth heauen onely ouerlooke rule order mortall man looke place knowe case prouide mischiefes giue ayde danger therefore peter none although pascere feede rule yet rule like shepeheard like emperour neither sheepe christe committed peter hee loued peter charged hee woulde forwardnesse shewe zeale loue rest employe feeding christes flocke whereas maister sander quoteth chrysostome ioan hom knowe wherefore except shewe prerogatiue peter aboue rest shall heare iudgement peter authoritie notwithstanding prerogatiue act apost hom iam illud considera quod petrus agit omnia ex communi discipulorum sententia nihil authoritate sua nihil cum imperio nowe consider also howe euen peter doth thing common decree disciple nothing owne authoritie nothing commaundement rule therefore false maister sander affirmeth gouernement faithfull committed one aboue well perteine euery apostle peter feede sheepe christe distinction order sake made ministerie god peter acknowledged apostleship circumcision neither greatest chiefest parte church allotted gal vers therefore although one flocke christ vpon earth yet christe onely one shepeheard thereof one shepeheard affirmeth iohn vers although hee haue many seruauntes ouersee sheepe bee scattered many place whose collection one flocke locall visible must needes haue almightie inuisible shepeheard gather together mortal man neuer excellent least pope vilest man aliue cause although euery particuler flocke must haue one pastour perticular flock necessarie may haue one yet cannot whole church militant earth church militant haue one earthly man head therof albeit sander woulde proue particuler respect whole number elect yet vniuersall respect perticuler congregation earth one time vniuersall singular man possibly knowe much lesse gouerne therefore although christe vniuersall shepeheard wil suffer particuler church continue without seruaunt ouersee vnder yet hee committ seruaunt charge impossible execute ouersight catholike vniuersall church vppon earth note impudencie papistes affirme particular synagogue rome catholike vniuersall church yet denye whole church christ militant earth catholik churche shall neuer proued peter made christe firste sheapheard ouer sheepe christ earth otherwise apostle yet true tyrannie pope rome vppon good ground authoritie scripture hee banished realme cause soeuer papistes surmise speake plainly notwithstanding iniurious contumelious dealing pope deuorse first vnlawfull mariage gaue occasion enquire finde weake foundation vsurped power see rome buylded vppon king henrie departed societie churche rome onely vice men thereof false antichristian heresy obstinately mainteined ioyned selfe true auncient vniuersall church christe hee departed false newe sett vp schismaticall particuler synagogue rome saint augustine went manichee catholicke church king henrie eyght knewe whence hee went knewe hee also whither went euen rome seuen hilles ierusalem aboue mother v hee goeth hereticall church king henrie must goe catholike church christe hee without making newe church without church knowe age maister sander hee bee much aboue fourtie yeares olde hee borne baptized manye papistes hee calleth newe church church howe hee aunswere let aduise holde necessarie man must tarrie church hee baptized king henrie eight without churche church englande member catholike church christe neither hee call supreme head church englande title giuen popish clergie submission cast premunire edw hall hee receiued fully true doctrine christ banished false vsurped power ye pope bee imputed trayterous practises dissembling clergie although durste withstande thereof according samplar none ye painter grauer hath imagined image imagination samplar thereof crosse christ counterfet consequently distinction idoll deed many diuers figure formes therof see made newly conuerted paganisme yet honorable estimation reprochefull signe crosse christian time whereas iewell vpbraideth blasphemous prayer make crosse kneeling knee crux aue spes vnica alhaile crosse onely hope sander saith wordes doe conuince blasphemous doctrine shall neuer able auoide argument whiche grounded vpon haue need sa set good face wordes euen metall crosse speak oftentimes made herculian argument pray bring forth forsooth paul vsed phrase said god forbid glorie crosse christe good sir paul speaketh neither ye wodden crosse signe thereof death christ would make men beleeue namely say wordes crosse christ crucified thus would couer shame impudencie cannot escape thomas aquinas great saint doctour church sen di ar q affirmeth crosse christ worshipped latria diuine worshippe christ crucified worshipped euen vnto crosse speake say hayle crosse onely hope say one doctours opinion yet wordes hymne rubrike thereof shall conuince speake crosse christ beata cuius brachijs preci pependit seculi flatera facta est corpori predam que tulit tartari blessed crosse whose armes price worlde hang made beame weigh bodie tooke pray away hell immediately word rubrike biddeth quire turne altar crosse standeth sander saith follow wordes hayle crosse onely hope time passion increase rightehusnesse godly men giue pardon guiltie person plaine prayer made crosse christ nayles sweete weight thou onely hast beene worthie beare price world beeing mariner prepare hauen worlde made shipwracke whiche holie bloud shed lambes bodie hath annointed insensible blockes prate forgotten grammer taught v ioyning aduerbe verbe thinke haue learned little either grammer logike wee cannot see difference betweene proposition affirmatiue negatiue boy construe gregory latine haue b saide sayde imago melior est quam oratio image better prayer three faultes found citing fiue wordes great faultes warrant first writeth saide one onely bishop say ye end fourth action bishop legate subscribed allowed bene saide defence image man reclamed therefore hee might well write saide second fault said melior est imago maior est imago greater image thing may bee greater better great fault ouersight sense altered case meaneth greater better thirde fault translateth oratio prayer signifieth oration speech yet doeth signifie prayer also circumstance place would haue taken speeche oration sermon absurditie nothing lesse say greater force teache image sermon oration speeche seeing finde many faultes citing saying excuse absurditie pray see finde many cite spoken ioannes monke priest deputie vicar east defend blasphemie nisi fuissent necessariae imago ea propter stabilitionem factorum non fuissent osculati vt etiam meo iuditio cum sanctis euangelijs veneranda cruce aequivaleant shamelesse impudencie proue haue beene decreed approued councell selfe denie impietie falshood action read thus booke one ihon bishop thessalonica de angelis archangelis eorum potestatibus quibus nostras anima adiungo ipsa catholica ecclesia sic sentis esse quidem intelligibiles sed non omnino corporis expertes inuisibiles vt vos gentile dicitis verum tenui corpore preditos aereo siue igneo vt scriptum est qui facit angelos suos spiritus ministros eius ignem vrentem c angel archangel power vnto also adioyne soules catholike churche doth thinke deede intelligible altogether voide body inuisible gentile say haue thinne body either ayer fire writen maketh agels spirites minister burning fire c herevpon thorasius patriarke saide ostendit autem pater quod angelos pingere oporteat quado circumscribi possunt vt homines apparnerunt sacrum synodus dixit etia domine father hath shewed ought paint angel also seing may circuscribed haue appeared men holie synode said yea forsoth lord open falshood decreed approued angel soules men haue body ayer fire circumscriptible sander stand defence decreed general councel least let heare greatest councell multitude read namely laterane cap vnus est deus indiuisus essentia discretus personis creator omnium c ab initio temporis vtram que de nihilo condidit creaturam corporalem spiritualem angelicam scilices mundanam deinde humanam quasi comunem ex spiritu corpore constituta one god vndiuided essence distinct person creator thinges c beginning time created creature nothing bodily creature spirituall namely angel world afterward humane conclusion sacrifice whiche honor properly due god alone euen papistes confession giuen image none al impietie yet condemne pope rome heretike answere sander counted great impietie pernicious errour honorius sometime pope rome councell condemned heretike action actione definition second reason defence councel euerie word vttered father determination whole councel voyce euerie burgesse act parleament granted haue shewed consent synode moste speech haue recited maketh full determination third reason scripture better applied honouring image impugned maister iewell hath partely shewed hath shewed wel hath applied haue seene already fourth reason miracle tolde faith therefore derided credited faith whiche worde god miracle brought confirme worshipping image must needes bee againste faith speake many dreames alledged proue sander thinketh image might wel worke miracle shadowe peter heale disease saint paules girdle napkin heale disease driue diuels peter selfe confesseth himselfe much lesse shadowe vertue heale disease onely iesus christ ye men israel saith maruel look ye vpon v though owne power godlines made man walke peter owne person may looked vnto haue prayse miracle muche lesse shadowe paules girdle napkin least image god vsed meanes whiche wrought image neuer vsed againe man madde worship peter shadowe paules napkin elizaeus staffe hath vp also although wrought miracle hearbe reported grow vnder ye image paneade tooke vertue image hearbe god although point eusebius thinke credulous wise man shold haue ben write strange matter vpon reporte might haue seene himselfe within fewe dayes iourney generall answer promiseth bring euident reason euerie man ought beleeue obey generall councel vnder paine euerlasting damnation pray forsooth defended honouring image possession honouring image beene impossible image beene ouerthrowen beene first set vppe honoured lawlike reason deede master sander defende possession without title setting vp worshipping image first entered churche disseisure true spirituall worshippe god therefore diuers assises holden constantinople ephesus dispossessed true worshippe god restored vntill packed iurie nice put possession againe reiect councels constantinople ephesus priuate conuenticles holden darke hating light whole processe calling actes false idolatrous councell nice defaced shewe selfe voide reason honestie reason many councels helde thinges decreed obserued although recordes found large honesty would take aduauntage owne wronge haue burned recordes vrge aduersarie shew say folowed councell vse forefather councell constantinople also folowed vse elder father whose writing alledged image epiphanius estote memores dilecti filij ne ecclesiam imago inferatis nec sanctorum cemiterijs ea statuite sed perpetuo circumferte deum cordibus vestris quia etiam nec domo communi tolerentur non enim fa est christianum per oculos suspensum teneri sed per occupationem mentis mindefull beloued child bring image churche neither set ye vp buriall place saintes alwayes carye god heartes neither common house let tollerated lawfull christian man held suspense eye occupying minde againe cited chrisostomes saying no perscripta sanctorum fruimur presentia non sane corporum ipsorum sed animarum imago habentes non quae ab ipsis dictum sunt animorum illorum imago sunt wee enioye presence saintes writinges verilye hauing image body mindes thinges whiche saide image mindes likewise cited saying amphilochus sometime bishoppe iconium non enim nobis sanctorum corporales vultus tabulis coloribus effigiare curae est quoniam hijs opus non habemus sed politice illorum virtutum memores esse debemus haue regarde counterfet corporall face saintes table coloures haue need ought wisely mindfull vertues moreouer rehearsed sayinge theodotus bishop ancyn sanctorum formas specie ex materialibus coloribus formari minime decorum putamus horum cutem virtutes quae per scripta traditae sunt veluti viuas quasdam imago reficere subinde oportet ex hijs enim ad similem imitationem zelum peruenire possumus dicant enim nobis qui illas erigunt quaenam vtilitas ex illis ad se redit quod qualiscun que receiued opinion father finding agreeable confirme whereas arrians quarrelled worde nonlatin alphabet found scripture therefore would refuse helpeth nothing rastels vnwritten verity trueth nonlatin alphabet proued hundreth textes scripture truth trinitie although neither word found scripture quarell heretiques rastel popish heritique doth letter syllable word sound stand vpon sense meaning vnderstanding doctrine affirme perfectly contained scripture euer necessarie saluation paul saith al scripture inspired god profitable teach improue correct instruct righteousnes man god may absolute made perfect al good workes tim therefore olde customes referred vnto custome church god time patriarch prophetes apostle doctours followed vnitie god wordes thing wee desire might preuaile controuersies religion sentence wel inough placed momus could let thing alone sectio fro second face leafe first face leafe rastel order giuen god broken abused fulke saith bishop best redresse thereof restore againe state first beginning rastel saith bishop tell speaketh whereas affirmed paule appointed order touching ministration sacramentes vnto corinthian rastell simplie graunt order appointed god although paule say receiued christ deliuered difference hee maketh order giuen god must obserued without exception yet addeth exception reuelation especial licence god euer order paule giue saith subiect vnto church remoue pull vp shall please thus blasphemous dog barketh ye spirit god trust al sober christian mind rather beleue paul rastel saith order giuen cor man seem prophet spirituall let know ye thing yt write yt comandements god ra take vpon teach v ye order giue yt paul speaketh namely ye christian certein charitable supper called nonlatin alphabet august saith chrysost saith vse receiue ye sacramet note yt rast wil haue old customes tried ye father bringeth two doctor one contrarie ye ye purpose order taken away cotention disdaine ye rich ye poore therfore paule purposed bring againe yt order sitting eating supper altogether yt rich pore saying receiued lord deliuered reforme abuse ye sacramet reducing first institution iudgement rastell partly proued authoritie theophylact chiefly standeth vpon owne authoritie without reason howbeit manifest ye scripture paule reproued mingling prophane supper lordes supper appointing priuate house bodily refreshings eating drinking haue house saith eate drinke saying manifest would haue eating drinking church rastell dreameth onely eating drinking lordes supper therefore abuse mingling bodily supper spirituall supper lorde whereof came many abuse especiall seuering sundering congregation diuers partes ought haue receiued altogether laboureth reforme bringing first institution lord selfe rast following owne dreame asketh institution sitting together sunder eating church home yes forsooth christe institute supper foode soule body therefore celebrated congregation common saluation common bee mingled prophane banquet bellie cheare priuat house company meet church god wheras rastel chargeth iewel vnderstanding place alledgeth namely therefore come together eate tarie one saith pertaineth ye institution sacrament pot full plumb doth highway london sheweth wit honestie denyeth thing saint paule rehearseth namely wordes take eate body c institution sacrament originall paterne reforming corinthian disorder bicause time place vesture number communicant accidentall variable circumstance therein expressed diuinitie either ye institution sacrament contained ye scripture else first paterne reforme abuse yt set downe scripture would maruel monstrous assertion see ye obstinate papist cannot otherwise defend popish masse except denied ye institution sacrament patterne reformation conteyned scripture granted saith rast whiche farre absurde paule reduce corinthian first originall institution doe rich men bring meate church receiue sacrament haue filled belly forsooth christe instituted maner supper saith washe one anothers feete hauing commandement commandement litterally vnderstanded doe papistes breake require v confesse required done humilitie commaunded whereof sauiour christe gaue v example fact god graunt may obserue outwarde ceremonie commanded obserued signified thereby whereas maister rastell compareth receiuing kindes lay people ceremonie washing feete make seeme iustitution christ might altered one aswell declareth reuerence estimation hath institution christe ceremonie washing feete may altogether omitted fantasieth authoritie church one kind sacrament kindes also may likewise taken away people priest please churche rome denie conclusion hath gayned argument example hath proued assertion nothing beleeued without expresse worde god darkenesse perish wilfully offendeth rastel boast glorious light gospel obstinate blinde man vouchsafe see likewise calleth heresie papistrie darkenesse time afore would knowe glorious light gospell seene concerning light poperie kingdome beaste god iudgement darkened partes worlde apoc knowen sitte maketh rastel complices gnaw tonges anger faine demonstrate light farre beyond reache man eye sight among newe found landes wilde indian conuerted saith protestant popish monkes frier although easie proue protestantes also haue planted church newe founde landes gallia antartica follie boast far wide gospel spread europe blind see make acknowledge euen italy spaine haue yeelded great number martyr confessor al region europe maner day haue either vtterly banished papistry lest publik pope whose iudgment expositio therof shold well receiue acknowledge fidelitie keeping wtout corruption vtterly denie haue receiued gospell pope rather greeke churche neither doe acknowledge fidelitie pope leo tenth accounted ye gospel nothing else fable christe whiche brought great honor wealth seeth either reuerently pope preserued gospell cause kept vndestroied finally rastels prophane iesting riding post heauen declareth himselfe right papist say atheist maketh scorne religion hope life come euen pope leo saide death one thing gayne dying shoulde resolued concerning question immortalitie church psalmes vnderstoode english men forsooth syr psalme something may vnderstoode euerie englishe man hath capacitie vnderstanding rest may learne vnderstand many people vnderstand easiest chapter gospell muche lesse prophet psalmes sir often read may better vnderstoode least much necessarie knowe saluation singing vsed howe vnderstande thing singing taketh away vnderstanding forbidden church booke iniunction thousand people vnderstande hath small voice cornishe men northerne men fine londoner speech c bishop haue care prouide man well voyce quality able edifie people suche nation queen obedience vnderstande english tongue haue prayer owne tongue whiche saith forgotten thinke saith lyer haue good remembraunce saith haue one chapter better learned parishe another poorer flam fiue owne deuising yet saith would end confusion nothing read congregation vnderstoode present though wiser holie ghoste expresse wordes hath commaunded al may learne may comforted meaning congregation man straunge language comming chaunceably curiously beeing none flocke answere hath saint paule euen shamefull shifte impudent lie namely saint paule speaketh onely preaching graunteth must vulgar tongue gospell pistle could content also pleased pope holinesse saint paule nameth expressely onely preaching also praying giuing thankes singing psalmes hymnes obiecteth saint paule saith speaketh tongue edifieth himselfe giueth thankes strange tongue doeth giue thankes well true prayer speeche godly priuate congregation apostle meanes alloweth man vse strange tongue yes saith rast interpreter deede paule speaketh miraculous gifte strange tongue might vsed set forth god glorie interpreter churche might profited otherwise would haue god gift silent churche short rast affirmeth preaching selfe vnnecessarie picture may onely supplye wante thereof also necessarie faithfull people profitable eloquent learned sermon iewell himselfe would reason longer insensible idoll ye iust iudgement god made like vnto image whiche worshippeth whome hee putteth trust sectio leafe rastel bishoppe alledgeth augustine saieth fulk praiers wee must chirpe like birdes sing like men maketh none answere must learne vnderstand english read el chirpers though englishe men could vnderstand english latine sectio first face leafe face leafe rastel bishoppe citeth lawe iustinian priest shoulde speake audible voice fulk people might say amen therefore people shoulde vnderstande minister saith rastel aunswereth nothinge yt people may saye amen though vnderstand long mistrust person faith honesty belike priest knaue man shoulde saye amen masse good stuffe warrant people said amen priest wordes consecration prooue like luftie logician whiche findeth reason much rethorike yt bishop sermon yt exclude al figuration significatio body wil reason longer mr hath gotte day maine logike second abuse receiuing kindes abuse fault saith bishop priest masse consecrateth kind seeing receiuing made one part masse receiuing one kind onely abuse masse self know wil answer priest receiueth kindes deede sacrament bene instituted priest onely aunswere bene somewhat blood christ pertaine priestes surely sacrament blood shoulde denyed anye whome shedde blood rastelsectio second face leafe second face leafe fulk bishop saide canon masse manie cause verie vaine thinge vncertaine man redily tell father notwithstanding bishoppe saith many cause yet master rastell taketh exception argument though vncertaintie author onely shoulde refused comparing leudely certaine bookes holy scripture indighters although knowne yet onely author knowen acknowledged holy ghost pope innocent third saith came apostle say gregory first gregory thirde came neither apostle fro gregory first euen place mra citeth greg lib ep doth proue sufficiently greg reproueth order liturgie canon vsed time lord praier order said ouer sacramet wel ye praier scholasticus mr haue scholasticus signifie scholer disciple christ proper name altogether vntrue vnlikely greg thought apostle disciple christ haue bin ye auctor would neuer haue take vpo reproue seing thoght expediet yt lord praier said ouer ye sacrament vsed popish canon followeth also gregorie first author popish canon prooued haue bene made within compasse sixe hundreth yeres christ sectio second face leafe first face leaf rastel chargeth bishop shamefull lye fulke saying priest canon desireth god blesse christ body denying thing ye latin canon confesseth yt graecians vse word excuseth vehemency desire wheras word proue yt author liturgy beleeued ye bread temperall proued reason first reason vseth proue state spirituall much like pope whiche hee excuseth psal steede thy father sonnes borne vnto thee meaning saith apostle bishopps successours shalt thou appoint prince ruler ouer whole earth though none sonnes church apostle bishoppes successor though prophete spake temperall rule life spiritual kingdome inheritance worlde common faithfull life omitte controuersie two state worlde excellencye spirituall thinges ministery churche aboue office prince yet either graunt ministery simply superiour king emperour minister subiectes pope respect ought haue dignitie minister gospell whiche hee disdaineth preach another defence pontificall argument sweete misticall allusion familiare letter emperour deede greate familyaritie hee emperours time whome hee continuall discorde last like blasphemous dogge hee compareth argument vsed paule couering woman heades taken nature selfe whiche though satisfie contentious person whome nothing satisfie yet sufficient stronge ynough proue naturall comlynesse requireth case pope hath shadowe reason rest argumentes rehearsed bishop maketh generall reason church hath custome contende yet haue custome burne men refusing thinges able contende argument defende shauen crownes purple sandales holy water praying one tongue hee sayeth neuer taken secreat mystery church scripture applyed proue take harme like good ynough without scripture sauing saying ezechiell chap sprinkle cleane water hee seeth may bee applyed holy water though bee meant baptisme holy water putteth v mynde baptisme fynde meaning holy minister saying ambrose hierome augustine leo passeth ouer confession people dayes vsed receiue priest commonly hee denyeth alway hee weeneth proue chrysostome saith offer daily ambrose saith greece seruice many legion angel present fantasieth doeth priest saying oremus let v pray speake angel present pray yea froward papist say whome speaketh turneth sayth orate pro fratres sorores pray brother sister hee angel angel also prayeth oblation haue offered saluation haue receiued doeth meane angel haue taken rytes priest though none people present perhaps one sorie boy helpeth say masse prieste saith priuate person common officer euen hee baptizeth hee magistrate altar chaunge institution ordinaunce god baptisme may bee ministred one alone according institution thereof communion feast church ought bee kept without number guestes rest authority cited bishop canon apostle decree calixtus dialogue gregorie hee saith proue nothing people vsed communicate diuers thinges writing wee doe obserue though wee haue bound selues obseruing men decree papistes haue euer haue agreeable worde god wee obserue willingly although hee slaunder church suffer present communion doe communicate impudent shamelesse lye yet easily bee borne comparison blasphemy barketh priesthoode sauiour christe saying order melchisedech haue end stinking masse omitted priestes must daily enter sanctum sanctorum antichristian helhoundes challenge vnto selues peculiar priesthoode christe onely priest euer order melchisedech hath successours priesthoode heb blasphemous dogges haue hedge priest enter sanctum sanctorum holy place euery day whither christ hath entered found eternall redemption heb blasphemy rather defend giue ouer blasphemie priuate masse neither learning modestie conscience al rout able defend either lawfull auncient rastel sectio leafe fulk challenge bishop made priuate masse aunswereth nothing haue priuate masse mass one common masse trifling vpon terme say one word matter rastelsectio second face leafe leafe treateth receiuing communion kindes fulke bishop challenge communion neuer ministred one kinde man space yeres christes answereth first yet church dauger bicause matter indifferent lay people receiue one kind alledging proofe saying luther written hee throughly conuerted papistrie secondly hee proue receiued vnder one kind first bicause luke act mention bread ergo christe paule gaue communion one kind good consequent may proue christe paule receiued selues bread bicause mention wine yet papistes holde necessarie priest ministreth necessitie receiue kindes whereas ashamed negatiue consequence chargeth v like reasoning place augustine irenaeus c wheras slandreth v falsly except vpon affirmatiue excludeth thing like impudence saieth doe deny tertullian time sacrament one kinde carried home house doe vtterly deny neither euer able proue false saith cyprian time carried men house one kinde cyprian saith thing worde sounding end concerning custome sending sacrament bishop straungers came rome cited irenaeus ad victor whereby would proue sent vnder one kinde wine would soone waxe sower say vnderstandeth custome imagineth sacrament sent thousand myle bishop whereas onely table place sitte churche worste lodging soiourned rome passing ouer doeth reportes carrying sending sacrament whiche prooueth nothing communion one kinde might well carried sent one commeth fragment epistle basilius ad caesariam pratriciam also falsifieth translation rest papistes harding heskins doe saith ledde solitary life wildernesse priest keeping communion home receiue themselues communionem domi seruantes seipsis communicant meaning receiued one translateth communicate themselues gathering priest may well receiue himselfe churche people home whiche doth followe although neither wel done againe wil haue wine feare sauoring whereas dout strong wine groweth country preserued long sauoring bread fro moulding like ye example serapion point death priest sicke also sent boye sacrament vppon example vrgeth reseruation though necessarie yet matter controuersie secondly comunion one kind false sent willed dippe bread wine sent thing else rastell saith done case extreame necessitie one excommunicated could departe life receiued sacrament last example superstitious fact satyrus brother ambrose beeing baptised obteined sacrament ye christian yt ship
